triples.name: Second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: The SLM-r model explains how phonetic systems reorganize during naturalistic second language learning across the life-span.

triples.name: Language acquisition
triples.relevance: The model proposes that mechanisms for first language acquisition remain accessible for L2 learning without change across the life-span.

triples.name: Speech perception
triples.relevance: Speech perception is fundamental to the SLM-r, as the perceived phonetic dissimilarity of L2 sounds depends on how listeners process acoustic input.

triples.name: Phonetics
triples.relevance: The paper's core focus is on phonetic systems and how they reorganize in response to phonetic input during L2 learning.

triples.name: Theories of second-language acquisition
triples.relevance: The SLM-r is a revised model within the theoretical frameworks for understanding second-language acquisition, specifically addressing phonetic category formation during L2 learning.
